p: Eugenol oil inhibits the eye sprouts by causing necrotic injury in the apical meristem of the bud, leading to sprouting necrosis [ 63]. Eugenol can reduce the rate of sprout growth during storage in non-dormant tubers. Additionally, eugenol showed the least number of sprouts and shortest sprouts, while eugenol can also reduce sugars in the treated tubers, a process that appears to occur due to lower consumption levels of soluble carbohydrates [ 64].
